briefTitle: A Randomised Trial Using Highly Purified Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (HP-hCG) and Recombinant Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (rhCG) in Women Undergoing Controlled Ovarian Stimulation

armGroups.label: HP-hCG IM
interventionNames: Drug: highly purified human chorionic gonadotropin

armGroups.label: HP-hCG SC
interventionNames: Drug: highly purified human chorionic gonadotropin

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Pre-menopausal females between the ages of 18 and 39 years
* Documented history of infertility
* Body mass index (BMI) between 17.5 and 32.0 kg/m2
* Regular menstrual cycles

Exclusion Criteria:

* Known endometriosis stage III and IV
* Known polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS)
* History of recurrent miscarriage
* History of more than three previous controlled ovarian stimulation cycles

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Oocytes Retrieved
outcomeMeasures.description: Oocyte retrieval took place 36 h (±2h) after hCG administration. At oocyte retrieval the number of oocytes retrieved was recorded.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Metaphase II (MII) Oocytes
outcomeMeasures.description: Only applicable for insemination using intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI). The MII oocytes were counted prior to insemination.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Fertilized (2 Pronuclei (2PN)) Oocytes
outcomeMeasures.description: Fertilization was assessed by counting the number of pronuclei, which was recorded as 0, 1, 2 or \>2. Correct fertilization was defined as oocytes with 2PN.

outcomeMeasures.title: Positive β Unit of Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (βhCG) Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Defined as percentage of subjects with positive beta hCG. A positive β hCG was confirmed by a blood test obtained 13-15 days after transfer.

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinical Pregnancy Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Defined as percentage of subjects with clinical pregnancy. Clinical pregnancy was defined as at least one gestational sac 5-6 weeks after transfer.

outcomeMeasures.title: Frequency of Adverse Events (AEs)
outcomeMeasures.description: The number of treatment-emergent AEs (TEAEs) in each treatment group will be presented.

outcomeMeasures.title: Intensity of AEs
outcomeMeasures.description: The intensity of an TEAE would be classified using the following 3-point scale: mild (awareness of signs or symptoms, but no disruption of usual activity), moderate (event sufficient to affect usual activity \[disturbing\]) or severe (inability to work or perform usual activities \[unacceptable\]).
